intro: Heracleum sphondylium var. eradiatum, commonly known as the lesser hogweed, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters. The plant features large, compound leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbrella-like inflorescences, which are characteristic of the carrot family. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions, where it can become invasive.
